verbs.description: cose (third-person singular simple present coses, present participle cosing, simple past and past participle cosed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To make oneself cosy; to be snug.
examples: Told her of the bad cooking here; that I could get nothing to eat here or, sometimes, even at Shibden. We agreed we would have things nice sometime, our tastes suit & we are very thoroughly happy together. We cosed very comfortably.
